page.title: 02Services
page.content: Hibaldstow has seven shops.Gladwells and Church st. stores specialise in groceries.Mrs Turner runs the fish and chip shop. Mr Flemming sells both carpets and furniture and we have the New Image hairdressers. There is also a sub-post office that sell both the Scunthorpe Evening Telegraph and its rival the Lincolnshire Times.The old smithy is now closed but its modern verion in the form of 3 garages, service both the village bus companies ( 3 ),the village cars, and provide petrol sales.Hibaldstow has a church, a Methodist chapel and in the old school an Evangelical chapel.The club provides entertainments such as bingo, discos, darts and pool.The Wheatsheaf pub cater for local and passing trade whilst the hotel provides bed and breakfast accommodation for visitors.
